description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ltb1","text":"Step-by-step description on the use of iPATH3 on Uproc-DNA outputs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ice3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ov87","text":"Path3.0 (http://pathways.embl.de) is a web-application for the  visualization and analysis of cellular pathways. It is freely available  and open to everyone. Currently it is based on four KEGG global maps,  which summarize up to 158 traditional KEGG pathway maps, 192 KEGG  modules and other metabolic elements into one connected and manually  curated metabolic network. Users can fully customize these networks and  interactively explore them through its redesigned, fast and lightweight  interface, which highlights general metabolic trends in multi-omics  data. It also offers navigation at various levels of details to help  users further investigate those trends and ultimately uncover novel  biological insights. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4segp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahqht","text":"More information about iPATH3 can be found here : https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/46/W1/W510/4990021","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":50,"length":55,"key":0}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/46/W1/W510/4990021"}}}}
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"49kjl","text":"This protocol requires you to have a \"counts\" output file from Uproc. To learn more on Uproc and how to run this tool using the iMicrobe platform, read this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"b7duh","text":"Note : this protocol uses as an example set the sample SRS143565  from the HMP project. SRS143565 is a right cubital fossa WGS available here. The uproc-dna result for this sample is available in the description of this protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":55,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":88,"length":55,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":127,"length":14,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"dskp6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"21lkk","text":"In order to create a map showing the protein hits found in the sample by Uproc, go to the iPATH3 portal and select \"Tools\" on the top of the screen. Choose the \"Numeric data\" tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":90,"length":13,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ccrtc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6r9j8","text":"In the tool interface, use the browser to select your imput file from your computer. Note that you need to provide here the FILE_NAME.kegg.counts. The pfam28 annotation cannot be used in iPATH3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5brnm","text":"Select the following parameters :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cth43","text":"Field separator : comma","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"58a53","text":"Customization parameter : width (the line width range can be further customized in the \"Line width\" fields).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hd3d","text":"Ignore unknown IDs : yes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"987h5","text":"Vizualize on map : Microbial metabolism in diverse environments.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96k71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e28l1","text":"In fixed values, the user can customize the color and opacity of the pathway map.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ue4u","text":"When ready, the user can hit \"Vizualize in iPATH\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8j7i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"52tat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8s5sd","text":"After submitting the customization data, the current map  will be adjusted according to your selection. A new dialog will be  displayed, giving an overview of how your Uproc annotation list matched the map. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e01oe","text":"You can zoom in\/out in that map. By clicking on the edges of a pathway of interest, you can obtain additional information about the selected pathway. In this \"Detailed information\" window, howering the cursor on the reaction, pathway, enzyme will provide you with additional informations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8mvbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"890bi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"860b4","text":"selection matching statistics window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":36,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4807k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"av7r0","text":"You should also find a \"Selecting Matching\" window in this interface. The table lists all submitted IDs, with 3 numbers for each :   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5vkq","text":"Hits: shows the total number of edges\/nodes which were matched by each submitted ID.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dig0p","text":"Indirect hits: shows the number of  edges\/nodes matched through \"Select whole pathways\", \"Select whole  modules\" or \"Query reaction compounds\" options.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":14,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ff7d","text":"Conflicts: When multiple IDs with different parameters in your selection match the same element in the map, a confilct occurs. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"avq1c","text":"Click on any number in the table to highlight the corresponding edges\/nodes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aav9c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9p9tf","text":"controls window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1bqd5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"76ugv","text":"In order to download your customized map, go to the \"Controls window\", select \"EXPORT\". You can then export your map under your favorite file format.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"11dl4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"65qjl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c9u35","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"626ks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qkj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqih6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"n36c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"131892F0E2AC11E8BD53032549B54D36","url":"https:\/\/portal.hmpdacc.org\/files\/6d91411d5ede0689305232cc77f77340"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4C56FF50D94911E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","url":"https:\/\/pathways.embl.de\/"}},{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"6tvak","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"9p8um","text":"Map obtained for the sample SRS143565 . The map settings were the following : ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34hnu","text":"Field separator: comma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gqb5","text":"Calculation : simple average","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12bh","text":"Customization parameter : width (1 to 50px)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d4fsk","text":"Fixed values: color =red ; opacity =1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"30gk8","text":"Ignore unknown IDs: yes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d4bh","text":"Visualize on map: Microbial metabolism in diverse environments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c6rs0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31857","guid":"13CB7070DA6211E8A3A1ADC617FB52A4","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/9dt2kge.pdf","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/extensions\/pdf.png","original_name":"map1.pdf"}}]}}],"guid":"A1801A80D94811E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","id":677294,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Create a pathway map for a unique sample"}
steps.section: Create a pathway map for a unique sample

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"89f5m","text":"Note : This protocol uses as example sets the samples SRS143565 and SRS013542 from the HMP project. SRS143565 is a right cubital fossa WGS available here. SRS013542 is a fornix WGS available here. The results of uproc-dna for those samples can be found in the description part of this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":294,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":139,"length":14,"key":0},{"offset":181,"length":15,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8gjk3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1enlt","text":"In order to get a list a Kegg IDs from the uproc "kegg.counts" output, download the file from your Cyverse datastore. You will need to customize and run the following command. It will create a new file named "FILE_NAME.kegg.list" containing the list you will need for creating the map.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9too7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"8h96o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8r2v6","text":"In order to create a map showing the difference between the protein hits found in two samples, go to the iPATH3 portal and select "Tools" on the top of the screen. Choose the "ID overlap" tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":13,"key":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"5kin5","text":"Open the list of kegg ID obtained by the small script, paste it in the ID list inputs. The user can the choose the color and width of the pathways found in either list or in both. ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9eekr","text":"Choose to vizualize the hits on the "Microbial metabolism in diverse environments" map.","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b2o2c","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2q54o","text":"You should obtain a map as in step 1, showing the different hits in the two submitted lists. As describe in step 1, you can interact with this map to learn more about the hits.","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ebvd1","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"elbl8","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3j5e3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":4}],"data":[]},{"key":"d058f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6mev2","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beqdm","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5i46e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dv1fu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"131892F0E2AC11E8BD53032549B54D36","url":"https://portal.hmpdacc.org/files/6d91411d5ede0689305232cc77f77340"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"666AFCE0E2AC11E8BD53032549B54D36","url":"https://portal.hmpdacc.org/files/5a950f27980b5d93e4c16da124028f5b"}},{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":5063,"guid":"DA79EC20D94E11E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","align":null,"name":"DOWNLOAD_DIR=“Path/to/Your/Download/directory”
cd $DOWNLOAD_DIR

LIST=“Name_of_your_uproc_file.kegg.counts”
OUTPUT=“Name_of_your_uproc_file.kegg.list”

cat $LIST | while read LINE ; do
	IFS=', ' read -r -a array <<< "$LINE”
 	echo “${array[0]}” >> $OUTPUT
done","description":"Bash script to create a list of Kegg ID from the uproc counts output.","os_name":"","os_version":"","can_edit":true,"step_guid":"CA1A5540D94E11E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","command":"Bash script to create a list of Kegg ID from the uproc counts output."}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4C56FF50D94911E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","url":"https://pathways.embl.de/"}},{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"d63gv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"b1d9j","text":"map obtained for the samples SRS143565 (blue) and SRS013542 (red). The common pathways are displayed in green. The width of the pathway hit was set as 10px and opacity of 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3g33s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31856","guid":"8F915770DA6111E8A3A1ADC617FB52A4","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/9ds2kge.pdf","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/pdf.png","original_name":"map.pdf"}}]}}],"guid":"CA1A5540D94E11E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","id":677311,"previous_id":677294,"previous_guid":"A1801A80D94811E88EDC4F4A30F5FA02","section":"Create a pathway map comparing two samples"}
steps.section: Create a pathway map comparing two samples
